main event: A group observed a bright, pear-shaped light moving rapidly in a swerving course on August 8, 1961, near Carlisle, Pennsylvania.
interesting points: The light was at an altitude of 10,000 ft and appeared to stop before accelerating straight up out of sight in 5-10 seconds., The observation duration was between 5 to 10 minutes., The sighting occurred on a clear night where stars were visible., The group hesitated to report the sighting due to the prevalence of 'exotic objects' in the sky., The report mentioned potential visual impairments affecting the observation.
witness description: a group holding a meeting on a mountain top
